com.bigdata.ha.althalog

Interface IHALogReader


  • public interface IHALogReader
    Interface for reading on an HA Log. Readers can be requested of any HALogFile.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String HA_LOG_EXT
      The filename extension used for the HALog files.
      static FileFilter HALOG_FILTER
      A FileFilter that visits all files ending with the HA_LOG_EXT and the names of all direct child directories.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the Reader.
      void computeDigest(MessageDigest digest) 
      IRootBlockView getClosingRootBlock()
      The IRootBlockView for the committed state AFTER the write set contained in the HA log file has been applied.
      IRootBlockView getOpeningRootBlock()
      The IRootBlockView for the committed state BEFORE the write set contained in the HA log file has been applied.
      boolean hasMoreBuffers()
      Checks whether we have reached the end of the file.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Return true if the root blocks in the log file have the same commit counter.
      IHAWriteMessage processNextBuffer(ByteBuffer clientBuffer)
      Attempts to read the next IHAWriteMessage and then the expected buffer, that is read into the client buffer.

    • Field Detail

      • HA_LOG_EXT

        static final String HA_LOG_EXT
        The filename extension used for the HALog files.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HALOG_FILTER

        static final FileFilter HALOG_FILTER
        A FileFilter that visits all files ending with the HA_LOG_EXT and the names of all direct child directories. This FileFilter may be used to establish recursive scans of the HALog directory.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        void close()
           throws IOException
        Closes the Reader.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Return true if the root blocks in the log file have the same commit counter. Such log files are logically empty regardless of their length.

      • getOpeningRootBlock

        IRootBlockView getOpeningRootBlock()
        The IRootBlockView for the committed state BEFORE the write set contained in the HA log file has been applied.

      • getClosingRootBlock

        IRootBlockView getClosingRootBlock()
                                   throws IOException
        The IRootBlockView for the committed state AFTER the write set contained in the HA log file has been applied.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • hasMoreBuffers

        boolean hasMoreBuffers()
                       throws IOException
        Checks whether we have reached the end of the file.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • processNextBuffer

        IHAWriteMessage processNextBuffer(ByteBuffer clientBuffer)
                                  throws IOException
        Attempts to read the next IHAWriteMessage and then the expected buffer, that is read into the client buffer. The IHAWriteMessage is returned to the caller.

        Note: The caller's buffer will be filled in IFF the data is on the HALog. For some IHABufferStrategy implementations, that data is not present in the HALog. The caller's buffer will not be modified and the caller is responsible for getting the data from the IHABufferStrategy (e.g., for the WORMStrategy).

        Note: IF the buffer is filled, then the limit will be the #of bytes ready to be transmitted and the position will be zero.

        Parameters:
        clientBuffer - A buffer from the DirectBufferPool.INSTANCE.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • computeDigest

        void computeDigest(MessageDigest digest)
                   throws DigestException,
                          IOException
        Throws:
        DigestException
        IOException
